Speaker: Bruce Schneier
Script: So I actually disagree that openness is not a remedy. Openness is a remedy. The best security protocols we have in the Internet have been designed openly either by NIS, by the government, in open process, by industry through the IETF, another open process. Protocols that are developed in secret systems in secret tend not to work well. So basically I view security failures on the Internet as market failures that the incentives aren't aligned for whoever has the ability to secure to do it.
